meanings.definition: To serve as an umpire in a game or match.
meanings.sent1: During the baseball game, I will ump to make fair calls.
meanings.sent2: The referee will ump the soccer match tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I tried to ump the argument between my friends, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to ump the debate brought clarity to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked me to ump the spelling bee to ensure fairness.

meanings.definition: A person who serves as an umpire.
meanings.sent1: The ump signaled a home run with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent2: The baseball ump wore a black and white striped shirt.
meanings.sent3: The ump's call was final, ending the game in a tie.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the strictest ump in the league.
meanings.sent5: The ump's whistle echoed across the field, signaling a foul.

meanings.definition: A sound made to express hesitation or doubt.
meanings.sent1: He let out an ump before deciding on his answer.
meanings.sent2: The ump from the audience interrupted the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The ump from the back of the room made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her constant umps during the speech were distracting.
meanings.sent5: The ump from the shy student was barely audible.
